reviews.review_msg: She is a kind prof but there was only like 3 aspects where we were graded on: Midterm, Final, and Labs. Barely went to lectures and still did alright. There is no textbook she just relies on slides. Labs were also interesting. Midterms are fair.
The class was stress free. Easy to communicate with the instrucor. I enjoyed the class it relates to the real world.
He delivered the materials in a nice and simple way. He was so helpful during lab tutorials.

Makes mistakes in lecture, accent can be difficult, just reads his slides. He's not responsive to feedback and answers without understanding your question (akes you feel stupid for asking). Midterm was writing intensive, took the entire time period, and required more than was covered in lecture. Lecture material was easy. Labs okay but unclear.

Grad student. Cannot communicate effectively, so course content, interaction, and student learning suffer.  Take equivalent BISC 204 instead, or wait for a non-sessional instructor. He means well, but he is just not adequately responsive to questions/discussions (lacks communication skills). Disappointing and substandard for university.

What a sweet guy. Very organized with his lectures, slides were printed out in a book for us to purchase. Explained everything really well at a level we could understand.  However, hes very much a 'grandpa' and having lectures at 10:30 on a friday make class very sleep worthy. Make sure to drink your coffee!! No midterm and easy/fun term project!
Very organized. Lectures flow and he covers a lot of material. Marks are split fairly well. Enjoys the subject material and is willing to share his knowledge. Clear and concise.
Remember bring tons of paper for his lecture, no overhead, tough exam
Very clear and organized, interesting lectures, English accent
